perturbation.original_text: Bravatek agrees to serve as a non-exclusive project sales lead finder for COMPANY. In this capacity, Bravatek will use its best efforts to provide the following services to COMPANY. a. Promote, market and introduce the Products to prospective clients in the government space nationwide.
perturbation.changed_text: Bravatek agrees to serve as a project referral source for COMPANY. In this capacity, Bravatek will use its reasonable endeavors to provide the following services to COMPANY. a. Promote, market and introduce the product to prospective clients in the government space nationwide.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'non-exclusive project sales lead finder' to 'project referral source' and 'best efforts' to 'reasonable endeavors' weakens Bravatek's obligation. 'Products' is also changed to 'product,' implying a more limited scope. This creates uncertainty regarding Bravatek's exact responsibilities and the scope of what they are marketing.

perturbation.original_text: COMPANY agrees to use its best efforts to promote and support project lead finding and after-sales support of Bravatek by: a. Listing Bravatek in all appropriate sales and marketing materials as a non-exclusive alliance partner (with focus of government customers) b. Provide timely responses to both technical and administrative questions posed by Bravatek.
perturbation.changed_text: COMPANY will endeavor to promote and support project assistance and after-sales assistance of Bravatek by: a. Listing Bravatek in some sales and marketing documents as an alliance partner (with focus of government customers) b. Provide responses to technical and administrative questions posed by Bravatek.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'best efforts' to 'will endeavor,' 'all appropriate sales and marketing materials' to 'some sales and marketing documents,' 'non-exclusive alliance partner' to 'alliance partner,' and removing 'timely' weakens COMPANY's obligations. This introduces ambiguity about the extent of COMPANY's support and responsiveness.

perturbation.original_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: For any product or solution sold to any potential clients introduced by Bravatek notified to COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-associated distribution entity(s) or sales route(s), Bravatek will receive a referral payment, to be discussed by COMPANY at the amount of 10% to 20% of project income, with a payment depending upon the project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable 45 days after each client payment on fulfilled products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'perspective clients' to 'potential clients', 'registered with' to 'notified to', 'COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s)' to 'COMPANY-associated distribution entity(s) or sales route(s)', 'lead-finder fee' to 'referral payment', 'mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY' to 'discussed by COMPANY' and 'NET 30 days' to '45 days' creates confusion on what the exact amount of compensation and time frame will be. The change from 'mutually discussed' to 'discussed by COMPANY' weakens Bravatek's negotiation power and the payment terms.
